title: System can be shut down without save file warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file and the user attempts to shut down the computer, a warning message box should be displayed to give users a chance to save their dirty file(s).
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:

1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the "Shut Down" command to shut down or reboot the computer.

Expected behavior: A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty file(s) before the computer is shut down or rebooted.

Note: This issue is not limited to WSWB, other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook, etc.) may behave in the same way.
